meanings.definition: Any of a group of simple proteins soluble in salt solutions and forming a large fraction of blood serum protein.
meanings.sent1: Globulins are proteins that can dissolve in salty liquids.
meanings.sent2: The doctor mentioned the importance of globulins in the blood test results.
meanings.sent3: The globulins in the serum were having a party in the salty solution.
meanings.sent4: Her love for globulins was as strong as their solubility in salt solutions.
meanings.sent5: The globulins danced happily in the salt solution, showing their solubility.

meanings.definition: A protein that is insoluble in water but soluble in salt solutions and coagulable by heat.
meanings.sent1: When heated, globulins can coagulate in salty liquids.
meanings.sent2: The chef explained how globulins react to heat in the cooking process.
meanings.sent3: The globulins refused to dissolve in water but loved the heat of the salty solution.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the coagulation of globulins under heat.
meanings.sent5: The globulins transformed into a solid mass under the influence of heat, like magic.
